Room.Name: City Hall
Room.Description: The mayor and the council hold their meetings here.Right now though, there is only a secretary here since the council does not meet today. To the south you can get on Common Road and to the west is Harbor Way and the headquarters of the city guards.

Room.Name: Harbor Road
Room.Description: This road leads from Southharbor up to the White Tower walls. Everyone who is going from Southharbor to the White Tower uses this road. To the east is City Hall where the mayor of Tar Valon holds council. To the south lies the Common Square where the people of Tar Valon voice their complaints. To the west lies the headquarters of the guards and to the north is the road around the walls of the White Tower.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: You are on the road around the wall surrounding the White Tower.As you gaze up at the White Tower you are amazed by its height and icy smooth paleness. The wall road continues to the east and west. The White Tower is directly to you north but the wall is unbroken here. Harbor Road runs south to Southharbor.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: You are on the road around the wall surrounding the White Tower.As you gaze up at the White Tower you are amazed by its pale height and radiating power. The wall road continues to the east and west. The White Tower is directly to the north, but the wall is unbroken here. South of here is the backside of City Hall.

Room.Name: Southeast Corner of White Tower Wall
Room.Description: You are at the southeast corner of the road around the wall surrounding the White Tower. As you gaze up at the White Tower, you are amazed by its pale height and the power of the Aes Sedai who dwell within it. To the north and west the road continues around the tower.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: You are on the road around the wall surrounding the White Tower.As you gaze up at the White Tower you are awed by its pale height and power. The wall road continues to the north and south. The White Tower is directly to the west but the wall is unbroken here and to the east are the backs of some houses.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: You are on the road around the wall surrounding the White Tower. As you gaze up at the White Tower you are amazed by its pale height and beauty. The wall road continues to the north and south. East of here is the Tower Square and one of the bridges leading out of the city and to the west the wall of the White Tower runs unbroken.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: You are on the road around the wall surrounding the White Tower.As you gaze up at the White Tower you think greedily about the treasures hidden within. The wall road continues to the north and south. The White Tower is directly to the west but the wall is unbroken here. East of here you see the backs of some houses.

Room.Name: Northeast Corner of White Tower Wall
Room.Description: You are at the northeast corner of the road around the wall surrounding the White Tower. As you gaze up at the White Tower, you are amazed by its pale height and majestic grandeur. To the north lies the Bridge Road, to the west and south the Wall Road leads around the White Tower, and to the east are what appear to be the backs of some houses.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: You are on the road around the wall surrounding the White Tower.As you gaze up at the White Tower you are amazed by its pale height. The wall road continues to the east and west. To the north is the back wall of a tavern and to the south is the unbroken wall around the White Tower.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: You are on the road around the wall surrounding the White Tower.As you gaze up at the White Tower you at its height and pale sleekness.The wall road continues to the east and west.The White Tower is directly to your south, but the wall is unbroken here.To the north, Sailor Way leads to Northharbor.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: You are on the road around the wall surrounding the White Tower.As you gaze up at the White Tower you are amazed by the height of it.To the north is a small door, probably leading to the kitchens of an inn.The wall road continuesto the east and west.The White Tower is directly to your south but the wall is unbroken here.

Room.Name: Northwest Corner of White Tower Wall
Room.Description: You are at the northwest corner of the road around the wall surrounding the White Tower. As you gaze up at the White Tower, you are amazed at the sheer height of it and the pale sleekness of the stonework. To the north is Bridge Road, to the south the Wall Road leads to the gates of the White Tower and to the east the road continues around the tower.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: You are on the road around the wall surrounding the White Tower.As you gaze up at the White Tower you are amazed at its pale height and majestic grandeur. The wall road continues to the north and south. The White Tower is directly to the east, but the wall is unbroken here. To the south lies the main entrance to the White Tower and to the west are the backs of some shops.

Room.Name: Gate of the White Tower
Room.Description: This is the main entrance to the grounds of the White Tower.You gaze up in awe at the height of the White Tower.It's pale surface stretches up as high as you can see.Petitioners come through here on their way to see the Amyrlin.To the north and south a road follows the walls of the White Tower. To the west you can get back to the market square.There is a small sign on the wall.

ExtraDescription.Description: The White Tower is under construction by Rhax.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: You are on the road around the wall surrounding the White Tower.As you gaze up at the White Tower you are amazed at the height of the tower and awed by the power of the women who reside within.The wall road runs to the north and south.The White Tower is directly to your east but the wall is unbroken here.West of here are the backs of some shops. To the north of here is the main entrance to the White Tower.

Room.Name: Southwest Corner of White Tower Wall
Room.Description: You are at the southwest corner of the road around the wall surrounding the White Tower.As you gaze up at the White Tower, you are amazed by its height and the pale stonework of the Ogiers.To the north the Wall Road leads to the gates of the White Tower and to the east the road continues around the tower.

Room.Name: Kitchens Entrance
Room.Description: You stand on Wall Road at the servant's entrance to the White Tower.It is a small gate known as Tarlomen's Gate but nonetheless guarded closely.To the east the wall road continues and to the west is the southwest corner of the White Tower.

Room.Name: Common Square
Room.Description: This large square has several benches around it for people to sit on and a pretty fountain in the middle.This is where the people of Tar Valon come to voice their opinions on city matters.Harbor Road runs north and south of here and Common Road runs east and west. ** You can go down to get to mud school (below level 5)

Room.Name: Harbor Road
Room.Description: This road leads from Southharbor up to the White Tower walls.Everyone who is going from Southharbor to the White Tower uses this road.To the east is a seamstress's shop and to the west is where a carpenter works.To the north lies Common Square and to the south, Harbor Road runs to Southharbor.

Room.Name: Harbor Road
Room.Description: This road leads from Southharbor up to the White Tower walls.Everyone who is going from Southharbor to the White Tower uses this road.To the east is a trader's shop, to the west is a wine shop and Harbor Road runs to the north and south.

Room.Name: On the Docks
Room.Description: You are standing here on the docks of Southharbor gazing in awe at the number of ships here.The workers are scurrying about under their captains' shouts. To the east and west you see more docks stretching out about the great Ogier-made harbor.To the north you see the beginning of Harbor Road and beyond that the White Tower rising above the city in the middle of the island. To the south are the clear blue waters of the River Erinin as they flow down to the sea.

Room.Name: On the Docks
Room.Description: You are standing here on the docks of Southharbor gazing in awe at the number of ships here.The workers are scurrying about under their captains' shouts. To the east and west you see more docks stretching out about the great Ogier-made harbor.To the south are the clear blue waters of the River Erinin as they flows down to the sea.

Room.Name: On the Docks
Room.Description: You are standing here on the docks of Southharbor gazing in awe at the number of ships here.The workers are scurrying about under their captains' shouts. To the east and west you see more docks stretching out about the great Ogier-made harbor.To the south are the clear blue waters of the River Erinin as they flow down to the sea.

Room.Name: On the Docks
Room.Description: You are standing here on the docks of Southharbor gazing in awe at the number of ships here.The workers are scurrying about under their captains' shouts. To the west you see more docks stretching out about the great Ogier-made harbor.To the north you see the beginning of Merchant Way and beyond that the White Tower rising above the city in the middle of the island.To the south are the clear blue waters of the River Erinin as they flow down to the sea.

Exit.Description: You see a large square to the west.

Room.Name: Merchant Way
Room.Description: You are travelling along Merchant Way.The number of people here is over- whelming.To the east you see a tavern with a large sign and to the west is an inn with a small sign.To the north you can see Merchant Way and to the south lies the square.

Room.Name: The Leaping Trout
Room.Description: This small inn has few customers.The tavern across the way seems to have all the business.The walls are covered with paintings of different fish and you can smell a good fish stew being cooked over the fireplace.You can get back to Merchant Way to the east.

Room.Name: The Tairen Fishmonger
Room.Description: This tavern seems to have drawn quite a crowd.It seems a very plain place, you can't imagine what's drawing them all here.....until you taste the ale. This place has the best ale in Tar Valon and the sailors know it.You can get back to Merchant Way to the west or to the small quiet inn across the way.

Room.Name: Merchant Way
Room.Description: You are travelling along Merchant Way.The number of people here is over- whelming.To the east you see a tavern with a small sign and to the west is an inn with a large sign.To the south you can see Merchant Way and to the north lies the square.

Room.Name: The Woman of Tanchico
Room.Description: This brightly lit inn has two fireplaces with fires going.The walls are covered with warm wood paneling and you can pull up a chair to one of the fire.The customers are all quietly listening to the gleeman on a tabletop or else playing stones.You can get back to Merchant Way to the east.

Room.Name: The Tremalking Splice
Room.Description: This tavern is filled with tabac smoke and men trying to drink as much as they can.There is a small dice game going on in the corner though and a musician in the other corner.You can leave to the Common Road to the north or to Merchant Way to the west.

Room.Name: Midean's Square
Room.Description: This square takes the bulk of the entering foot traffic.The cobblestones have been worn smooth.A large fountain fills the center of the square.To the north and south runs Merchant Way and to the east runs Common Road.To the west is a bridge leading out of the city.

Room.Name: Merchant Way
Room.Description: You are travelling along Merchant Way.The number of people here is over- whelming.To the east you see an inn with a small sign and to the west is an inn with a large sign.To the north you can see Merchant Way and to the south lies the square.

Room.Name: The Common Man's Inn
Room.Description: This inn obviously serves the travelers coming in from the southwest bridge. The inn specializes in comfortable beds, good food, cold ale and mulled wine. The common room is empty except for the innkeeper and a maid who rushes over to help you.To the east is Merchant Way and another inn across the road.

Room.Name: The Andoran Guard
Room.Description: This inn is filled with suspicious looking people.However there is one room left upstairs.Maybe you should go up there before you get thrown through one of the few remaining unbroken windows.To the west you can escape to Merchant Way or the nice inn across the road.

Room.Name: Upstairs Room
Room.Description: This room has bars on the windows and a hard narrow cot in the corner.As you look out the window you wish you were at that nice inn across the way. You think you hear footsteps on the stairs....you can't get out! It's just the innkeeper....you were lucky this time.

Room.Name: Merchant Way
Room.Description: You are travelling along Merchant Way.The number of people here is over- whelming.To the east you see an armory and to the west is a weaponsmith.To the north you can see Merchant Way and the Market Square and to the south is Merchant Way and the square.

Room.Name: Smithy
Room.Description: This large room has a forge in the back and several different anvils for work on different types of metal.The noise from the smith hammering a sword is hurting your ears.Weapons for sale are hanging on the walls.To the east you can get back on Merchant Way or go to the armory across the street.

Room.Name: Armory
Room.Description: This room is filled with wooden figures wearing suits of armor.The armorer gets armor from several different countries as well as making his own.There is a magnificent copy of the commander of Tar Valon's armor here, his proudest achievement.To the west lies Merchant Way and a weaponsmith works across the street.

Room.Name: Merchant Way
Room.Description: You are travelling along Merchant Way.The number of people here is over- whelming.To the east you see a farmer's market and to the west is a bakery. To the north lies Market Square and to the south Merchant Way continues.

Room.Name: Bakery
Room.Description: This store is filled with the aroma of bread and pies baking.You could stay in here forever with these wonderful smells.The shelves are lined with fresh loaves of bread and the counter top is covered with pies and pastries. Merchant Way is back to the east and there is a farmer's market across the way to buy vegetables to go with this bread.

Room.Name: Farmer's Market
Room.Description: The farmers in this area have gotten together to rent this store so they can sell their produce directly to the citizens of Tar Valon.Today they are selling carrots and cabbage.Merchant Way is to the west and a bakery is across the way.

Room.Name: Market Square
Room.Description: This market is buzzing with activity.Merchants come through here and so do petitioners for the White Tower.This square is made all from cobblestone ....trees couldn't survive this many people, horses and wagons.To the north and south runs Merchant Way.To the west you see a bridge leading out of Tar Valon and to the east are the gates of the White Tower.

Room.Name: Bridge Gate
Room.Description: You are at the gates to Tar Valon.To the west you see a bridge leading to a path out of the city and to the east is the Market Square.These gates are only closed during a time of war.From here you can see the White Tower rising from the center of the island.

Room.Name: Merchant Way
Room.Description: You are travelling along Merchant Way.The number of people here is over- whelming.To the east you see a general store and to the west is a meat market.To the north you can see Merchant Way and Tarlomen's Square and to the south lies Market Square.

Room.Name: Meat Market
Room.Description: This store has several freshly slaughtered carcasses hanging behind the counter.This butcher also offers some cooked items for those in a real hurry.To the east is Merchant Way and you can see another store across the way.

Room.Name: General Store
Room.Description: This store is filled with useful items like bags, wheels, boxes, nails and anything else you could want that is not particularly valuable.To the west you can see Merchant Way and a meat market across the way.

Room.Name: Merchant Way
Room.Description: You are travelling along Merchant Way.The number of people here is over- whelming.To the east you see a clockmaker's shop and to the west is a jeweller's store.To the north you can see Tarlomen's Square and to the south Merchant Way continues to the Market Square.

Room.Name: Jeweller's Store
Room.Description: This store has many fine pieces of jewellery on display but of course the finer pieces are locked away.To the east is Merchant Way and you can see a clockmaker across the way.

Room.Name: Clockmaker's Shop
Room.Description: This shop is filled with all sorts and shapes of clocks.There is a huge grandfather clock in the corner and the clockmaker is working on a tiny bird-shaped clock.The noise from all the ticking is beginning to get to you.To the west you can escape back to the normal bustle of Merchant Way.

Room.Name: Tarlomen's Square
Room.Description: You stand in one of the many squares dotting this city.A small fountain is in the center of this square surrounded by a few trees.This square is bustling with people from Merchant Way to the south.To the north you can see a sign hanging over a tavern, to the west is a gate leading out of the city and to the east is Bridge Road which leads into the heart of Tar Valon.

Room.Name: Bridge Gate
Room.Description: You are at the gates to Tar Valon.To the west you see a bridge leading to a path and to the east is Tarlomen's Square.These gates are only closed during a time of war.From here you can see the White Tower rising from the center of the island.

Room.Name: The Illianer Maid
Room.Description: This tavern has several people passed out on the floor.The rest are listening to the musician in the corner.Several paintings adorn the walls. You can get back to Tarlomen's Square and Merchant Way to the south.

Room.Name: Bridge Road
Room.Description: This is a small stretch of road leading from Tarlomen's Square to the west to the Wall Road surrounding the White Tower to the south.To the north you see an opulent inn with a sign waving in the breeze.

Room.Name: The White Swan
Room.Description: This inn is beautifully decorated.They aspire to only the richest of customers.Figurines of swans are everywhere and there are many landscape paintings with prominent swans swimming in lakes.To the south is the ugly bridge road.

Room.Name: Sailor Way
Room.Description: This road is no doubt named for the people who use it the most.Everywhere you look you see sailors, some singing, some passed out.To the north you see the Great Square and beyond that Northharbor.To the south is a road surrounding the White Tower.

Room.Name: The Great Square
Room.Description: This square makes up most of the length of the Great Road.The 'Great' Road spans the islands' narrowest point and as such is not so great.However there are some fine inns and taverns in this area.In the center of the square is a large fountain with some nice trees for drunks to sleep under. To the north you see Sailor Way and the Ogier-made Northharbor.To the south you see more of Sailor Way and the White Tower rising in the center of the island.To the east and west runs the Great Road with several inns and taverns.

Room.Name: The Great Road
Room.Description: This road certainly does not live up to its name as it is barely a half mile long as it stretches across this narrow neck of the island.There are many sailors and dock workers walking around this part of town.To the east is the Great Square, to the north is a rundown inn with a red sign, to the west is a tavern with a blue sign and to the south is a nice inn with a white sign.

Room.Name: The Mayene Mistress
Room.Description: This tavern has quite a few people in it, all there to listen to a gleeman who is telling a tale of the Great Hunt for the Horn.One of the serving girls brings you a mug of ale and you sit down to listen.To your east is the Great Road and the Great Square.

Room.Name: The Good Rest
Room.Description: This is a rather large tidy inn.You can see the kitchen in the back of the inn.To the north is the Great Road and another inn across the way.

Room.Name: The Inn's Kitchen
Room.Description: This kitchen is filled with the smell of fresh baked bread and roasting meats.The cook sits you down for a hearty meal.This whole place is too good to be true.To the north is the main room of the inn and to the south is a locked door.

Room.Name: The Rising Sun
Room.Description: This inn is so rundown that you wonder at its name.The paint is peeling off the walls and the maids all look tired and dirty.The only customers look very disreputable....maybe you should look for another inn to stay at. To the south is the Great Road and a very nice looking inn across the way.

Room.Name: The Great Road
Room.Description: This road certainly does not live up to its name as it is barely a half mile long as it stretches across this narrow neck of the island.There are many sailors and dock workers walking around this part of town.To the west is the Great Square, to the north is a tavern with a red sign, to the east is an inn with a white sign and to the south is a tavern with a brown sign and some very loud music coming out of it.

Room.Name: The Good Wind
Room.Description: This inn has many sailors for patrons and a few captains, no doubt hoping to get some good luck for their journey from the name of the inn.There is a gleeman in the corner juggling some colored balls since he can't compete with the noise coming out of the tavern next door.

Room.Name: The Musician's Itch
Room.Description: This tavern is crowded with sailors and a large number of musicians.The serving girls are hard put to keep up with all the requests for drinks. There are a few of the obligatory dice games but not many with so little room to spare.

Room.Name: The Whistling Dragon
Room.Description: This tavern only has a few quiet groups of men dicing, mostly sailors.Even the tavern owner is in a dicing game.The serving girls are taking advantage of their employer's distraction and are gossiping in the corner. To the south is the Great Road and another tavern across the way from which is issuing some very loud music.

Room.Name: Sailor Way
Room.Description: This road is no doubt named for the people who use it the most.Everywhere you look you see sailors, some singing, some passed out.To the north you see the great Ogier-made basin on Northharbor and the clear blue Erinin.To the east and west you will see two taverns one with a blue sign and the other's sign is red.To the south you see the Great Square and the tall White Tower rising above the city in the middle of the island.

Room.Name: The Fiery Wake
Room.Description: This tavern is overflowing with sailors.There are absolutely no empty chairs or benches.One of the walls is blackened, perhaps the reason for the name of the place.Maybe the tavern across the way is less crowded...

Room.Name: The Whispering Mountain
Room.Description: This tavern is overflowing with sailors.There are absolutely no empty chairs or benches.Maybe the tavern across the way will be less crowded...

Room.Name: On the Docks
Room.Description: You are standing here on the docks of Northharbor gazing in awe at the number of ships here.The workers are scurrying about under their captains' shouts. To the east and west you see more docks stretching out about the great Ogier-made harbor.To the south you see the beginning of Sailor Way and beyond that the White Tower rising above the city in the middle of the island. To the north is a large bridge over the clear blue waters of the River Erinin.

Room.Name: On the Docks
Room.Description: You are standing here on the docks of Northharbor gazing in awe at the number of ships here.The workers are scurrying about under their captains' shouts. To the west and east you see more docks stretching out about the great Ogier-made harbor.To the south you see a warehouse brimming with good.To the north are the clear blue waters of the River Erinin.

Room.Name: On the Docks
Room.Description: You are standing here on the docks of Northharbor gazing in awe at the number of ships here.The workers are scurrying about under their captains' shouts. To the east you see more docks stretching out about the great Ogier-made harbor.To the south you see a warehouse brimming with goods.To the north are the clear blue waters of the River Erinin.

Room.Name: Inside a Warehouse
Room.Description: This warehouse is filled with goods, most of which appear to be locked down securely except for the most recent shipment of Two Rivers tabac.To the north you can see the docks and beyond them the waters of the Erinin.

Room.Name: Inside a Warehouse
Room.Description: This warehouse is filled with goods, most of which appear to be locked down securely except for the most recent shipment of grain from Tear.To the north you can see the docks and beyond them the waters of the Erinin.

Room.Name: On the Docks
Room.Description: You are standing here on the docks of Northharbor gazing in awe at the number of ships here.The workers are scurrying about under their captains' shouts. To the west and east you see more docks stretching out about the great Ogier-made harbor.Farther to the east you see the dockmaster's office.To the south you see a warehouse brimming with goods.To the north are the clear blue waters of the River Erinin.

Room.Name: On the Docks
Room.Description: You are standing here on the docks of Northharbor gazing in awe at the number of ships here.The workers are scurrying about under their captains' shouts. To the west you see more docks stretching out about the great Ogier-made harbor.To the south you see a warehouse brimming with goods.To the north are the clear blue waters of the River Erinin.To the east you hear shouts coming from the dockmaster's office.

Room.Name: The Dockmaster's Office
Room.Description: This is a tiny room, barely big enough for the desk which fills it and the two men engaged in a shouting match.One looks like a captain of a ship so the other must be the dockmaster.There are some shipping lists posted on one wall and behind the desk hangs a painting of a Domani woman.

Room.Name: Inside a Warehouse
Room.Description: This warehouse is filled with goods, most of which appear to be locked down securely except for the most recent shipment of furs from Saldaea. To the north you can see the docks and beyond them the waters of the Erinin.

Room.Name: Inside a Warehouse
Room.Description: This warehouse is filled with goods, most of which appear to be locked down securely except for the most recent shipment of olive oil from Mayene.To the north you can see the docks and beyond them the waters of the Erinin.

Room.Name: Headquarters of the Guards
Room.Description: Here all the guards come to pick up their shift assignments and where their beats are.To the east is Harbor Road and to the south is another door to Common Road.

Room.Name: Common Road
Room.Description: This road passes between the southeast and southwest bridges.This road is mainly used by the citizens of Tar Valon when they go to the common square for the mayor to hear their problems.To the north lies the headquarters of the city guards, to the south is the side of a shop, to the east is Common Square and to the west Common Road continues to Midean's Square.

Room.Name: Common Road
Room.Description: This road passes between the southeast and southwest bridges.This road is mainly used by the citizens of Tar Valon when they go to the common square for the mayor to hear their problems.To the west lies Midean's Square, to the north is the side of an inn, to the south is the entrance to a tavern and Common Road continues to the east.

Room.Name: Bridge Gate
Room.Description: You are at the gates to Tar Valon.To the west you see a bridge leading to a large plain and to the east is the square.These gates are only closed during a time of war.From here you can see the White Tower rising from the center of the island.

Room.Name: Common Road
Room.Description: This road passes between the southeast and southwest bridges.This road is mainly used by the citizens of Tar Valon when they go to the common square for the mayor to hear their problems.To the west lies Common Square, to the north is city hall, to the south is the side of a shop and to the east, Ogier Road leads to Ogier Square.

Room.Name: Ogier Road
Room.Description: This road runs past the Ogier grove where the great trees grow so that the Ogier won't be as homesick while the work on the White Tower. The grove is surrounded by a wall of sorts made from spiralling arches each large enough for a few people to pass through. You can see the great trees towering above everything else. To the east is the Ogier square, to the south the Ogier Road continues and to the west lies the Common Road.

Room.Name: Ogier Road
Room.Description: This road runs past the Ogier grove where the great trees grow so that the Ogier won't be as homesick while the work on the White Tower. The grove is surrounded by a wall of sorts made from spiralling arches each large enough for a few people to pass through. You can see the great trees towering above everything else. To the east you can enter the grove and to the south and north runs the Ogier Road.

Room.Name: Ogier Road
Room.Description: This road runs past the Ogier grove where the great trees grow so that the Ogier won't be as homesick while the work on the White Tower. The grove is surrounded by a wall of sorts made from spiralling arches each large enough for a few people to pass through. You can see the great trees towering above everything else. To the north the Ogier Road continues, and to the east lies the Ogier grove.

Room.Name: Ogier Grove
Room.Description: This grove is the ideal of nature. Every plant seems to be in exactly the right place and exactly the right color. The grass under your feet is neither manicured nor haphazard. About you are towering oaks and elm trees. You can get back to civilization to the Ogier road to the west and the grove lies to the north and east.

Room.Name: Ogier Grove
Room.Description: This grove is the ideal of nature. Every plant seems to be in exactly the right place and exactly the right color. The grass under your feet is neither manicured nor haphazard. This is a small meadow in the midst of the Great Trees which are more than 100 paces high. This seems like a great place to relax. The grove continues to the north, east and west.

Room.Name: Ogier Grove
Room.Description: This grove is the ideal of nature. Every plant seems to be in exactly the right place and exactly the right color. The grass under your feet is neither manicured nor haphazard. You are close to the river now, and you can see the steep cliffs leading down the Erinin. You can only go to the north or west.

Room.Name: Ogier Grove
Room.Description: This grove is the ideal of nature. Every plant seems to be in exactly the right place and exactly the right color. The grass under your feet is neither manicured nor haphazard. You are very deep in the grove now and all you can hear are the sounds of a few small animals. To the north you see a tall fence with spikes on the top enclosing part of the grove. The grove continues to the south and west.

Room.Name: Ogier Grove
Room.Description: This grove is the ideal of nature. Every plant seems to be in exactly the right place and exactly the right color. The grass under your feet is neither manicured nor haphazard. You are standing amidst the Great Trees which stand more than 100 paces tall. You can no longer hear any of the city's sounds and seem miles from the nearest town. The grove stretches out to the east, south and west.

Room.Name: Ogier Grove
Room.Description: This grove is the ideal of nature. Every plant seems to be in exactly the right place and exactly the right color. The grass under your feet is neither manicured nor haphazard. About you are towering oaks and elm trees and above them tower the Great Trees farther into the grove. The grove continues to the east and south or you can get back to civilization to the Ogier square to the north or the Ogier road to the west.

Room.Name: Ogier Square
Room.Description: This square lies north of the Ogier grove where the great trees grow so that the Ogier won't be as homesick while they work on the White Tower. The grove is surrounded by a wall of sorts made from spiralling arches each large enough for a few people to pass through. You can see the great trees towering above everything else. You may enter the grove to the south. To the east lies a bridge passing out of the city. To the north runs Tower Road and to the west lies Ogier Road and Common Road.

Room.Name: Bridge Gate
Room.Description: You are at the gates to Tar Valon. To the east you see a bridge leading to a forest and to the west is Ogier Square. These gates are only closed during a time of war. From here you can see the White Tower rising from the center of the island and the great trees of the Ogier Grove to the southwest.

Room.Name: Tower Road
Room.Description: You are in a residential part of town. All around you are houses of varying sizes, but they are all beautifully constructed thanks to the Ogier. To the east, a large house has been coverted into the Warrior's guild. A similar house is to the west, but this one with holy symbols over the door. To the north, Tower road continues.

Room.Name: Tower Road
Room.Description: You are in a residential part of town. All around you are houses of varying sizes, but they are all beautifully constructed thanks to the Ogier. To the east and west are houses, to the north the road leads to a large square locally known as Tower Square and to the south the Tower Road continues to the Ogier Square.

Room.Name: In a House
Room.Description: This house obviously belongs to the carpenter in town. Lovingly crafted chairs and tables adorn the room. He has also made several frames for mirrors and paintings which hang about the room but the rest of the decor is rather plain. To the west lies the Tower Road and another house across the way.

Room.Name: In a House
Room.Description: You are standing in the house of a merchant. This merchant is not very rich as seen by the absence of gold or silver in his house. He does have a good eye for color though and this room is very pleasing to the eye. It would be nice to relax in here but the merchant might come home. You can get back onto the tower road to the east.

Room.Name: Tower Road
Room.Description: You are in a residential part of town. All around you are houses of varying sizes, but they are all beautifully constructed thanks to the Ogier. To the east and west are houses, to the north the road opens up into a large square locally known as Tower Square and to the south the Tower Road continues.

Room.Name: In a House
Room.Description: This humble abode is decorated with dark colors making it seem very gloomy inside. You can't wait to get back out onto the street. Tower Road lies to the west and a much nicer looking home is across the way.

Room.Name: In a House
Room.Description: You are in a very small but beautiful home. The owner has decorated the house to make it seem larger. All the colors in here are pastels, a strong difference from most of the other houses in the city. Maybe it is part of the Great Game, trying to confuse people and put them off guard. You will never know since the owner is nowhere to be seen. Tower Road is to the east and another house is across the way.

Room.Name: Tower Square
Room.Description: This is a quiet square with few people moving about. Most people are on the other side of the island in the market area. To the north and south runs Tower Road with beautiful houses lining the way. To the east is the eastern bridge leading out of the city and to the west is the wall road and the walls of the White Tower.

Room.Name: Bridge Gate
Room.Description: You are at the gates to Tar Valon. To the east you see a bridge leading to nothing and to the west is Tower Square. These gates are only closed during a time of war. From here you can see the White Tower rising from the center of the island.

Room.Name: On the Eastern Bridge
Room.Description: You are on a high arching bridge leading into the city of Tar Valon. From here you can see the White Tower rising above the city in the center of the island. The bridge is made from stone but the carving is as intricate as lace. To the west you see a bronze gate and to the east is nothing.

Room.Name: Tower Road
Room.Description: You are in a residential part of town. All around you are houses of varying sizes, but they are all beautifully constructed thanks to the Ogier. To the east and west are houses, to the south the road opens up into a large square locally known as Tower Square and to the north the Tower Road continues.

Room.Name: In a House
Room.Description: This mansion is even bigger than the one across the street. The two owners, probably merchants, seem to be having a building war. This merchant seems to collect paintings. His painting of a woman from Mayene shows his taste in women. The furnishings of this house are done all in blue and silver. He also seems to have a fancy for finely carved chairs since he has so many here. You can get back to Tower Road to the west.

Room.Name: In a House
Room.Description: You are standing in a magnificent mansion just off of Tower Square. This home must belong to a very wealthy merchant. There is gold leaf everywhere and several locked display cabinets containing fine jewellery and pieces in cuendillar that the merchant collects. Too bad you can't get into them. The doors to all the other rooms are also securely locked. To the east you see Tower Road and another mansion across the way.

Room.Name: Tower Road
Room.Description: You are in a residential part of town. All around you are houses of varying sizes, but they are all beautifully constructed thanks to the Ogier. To the east and west are houses, to the north is the square and to the south the Tower Road continues.

Room.Name: In a House
Room.Description: This is a very nice house, maybe the mayor lives here. On the walls are some red and gold drapes. A blue carpet covers the floor, and there are chairs and tables to sit at. None of it is really worth taking though. To the west you can get back on Tower Road.

Room.Name: In a House
Room.Description: You are standing in a small house. The furnishings are all plain and simple. The owner must not be very rich. You see Tower Road back to the east.

Room.Name: Rogosh's Square
Room.Description: This square has a large statue in the center commemorating Rogosh Eagle-Eye. To the north is a tavern with a sign hanging out front. To the east lies a bridge out of the city. To the south runs Tower Road and the residential part of the city. To the west the Bridge Road runs to the White Tower at the center of the city.

Room.Name: The Charging Bull
Room.Description: This tavern is filled with farmers from outside the city, here to enjoy the good drink and the city life. Aren't they pathetic? You can get to Rogosh's Square and the Tower Road to the south.

Room.Name: Bridge Gate
Room.Description: You are at the gates to Tar Valon. To the east you see a bridge leading to a great plain and to the west is Rogosh's Square. These gates are only closed during a time of war. From here you can see the White Tower rising from the center of the island.

Room.Name: On the Northeast Bridge
Room.Description: You are on a high arching bridge leading into the city of Tar Valon. From here you can see the White Tower rising above the city in the center of the island. The bridge is made from stone but the carving is as intricate as lace. To the west you see a bronze gate.

Room.Name: Bridge Road
Room.Description: This is a small stretch of road leading from Rogosh's Square to the east to the Wall Road surrounding the White Tower to the south. To the north you see a small inn with a sign waving in the breeze.

Room.Name: The Golden Lion
Room.Description: This inn has a fiery golden decor. The common room has a gleeman reciting a tale in the Common Chant. This has drawn many people in to listen so good luck finding a room here tonight. To the south lies the Bridge Road.

Room.Name: Woodworking Shop
Room.Description: This shop is filled with half-finished chairs and tables. The smell of glue fills the air and the sound of hammering and sawing hurts your ears. You can get custom furniture for your home made here. The carpenter also makes small carved wooden figurines for display cases. You can get back to Harbor Road to the east.

Room.Name: Garment Shop
Room.Description: This shop is filled with bolts of fabric that you can pick to have a dress made from. The seamstress has a few dresses being made right now. She also makes coats, shirts, cloaks and any other clothing you might need. To the west lies Harbor Road.

Room.Name: Wine Shop
Room.Description: This is a large room with several tables segregated by screens for tasting wine and conducting business. On the walls are racks full of wine bottles. The proprietress also carries some harder liquors if you would prefer them. You can get back on Harbor Road to the east and there is a trader's shop across the way.

Room.Name: Trader's Shop
Room.Description: This store is filled with strange and unusual items from all over the world. You can get ivory, silk, exotic spices, cuendillar and other objects depending on how good a sale the trader has made today. You can get back to Harbor Road to the west and to the wineshop across the way.

Room.Name: On the Southwest Bridge
Room.Description: You are on a high arching bridge leading into the city of Tar Valon. From here you can see the White Tower rising above the city in the center of the island. The bridge is made from stone but the carving is as intricate as lace. To the east you see a bronze gate and to the west is a large plains.

Room.Name: On the Western Bridge
Room.Description: You are on a high arching bridge leading into the city of Tar Valon. From here you can see the White Tower rising above the city in the center of the island. The bridge is made from stone but the carving is as intricate as lace. To the east you see a bronze gate and to the west is path leading out of the city.

Room.Name: On the Northwest Bridge
Room.Description: You are on a high arching bridge leading into the city of Tar Valon. From here you can see the White Tower rising above the city in the center of the island. The bridge is made from stone but the carving is as intricate as lace. To the east you see a bronze gate and to the west is a path leading to Ofcol.

Room.Name: Large Square
Room.Description: You are at a large square connecting to the juction at the east. To the north you see a large building with many guards at the enterance. A sign on the building is painted as the sybol of Justice.

Exit.Description: The junction of Docs and merchant road is to the east.

Room.Name: Ogier Glade
Room.Description: Tucked away in a corner of the Ogier Grove, the Ranger's Guild comes here to relax among the beauty of nature.

Room.Name: On the Southeast Bridge
Room.Description: You are on a high arching bridge leading into the city of Tar Valon. From here you can see the White Tower rising above the city in the center of the island. The bridge is made from stone but the carving is as intricate as lace. To the west you see a bronze gate and to the east is a path to Tar Valon.

Room.Name: A Road Through The Plains
Room.Description: You can now see the broad river surrounding the island city of Tar Valon. One of the great bridges into the city is to the west. To the south the path wanders away between the trees.

Room.Name: The Path to Tar Valon
Room.Description: You are on a well beaten path leading to Tar Valon. You can see the high towers of the city from here as they tower above the trees. The path leads to a bridge to the north and runs south to other roads.

Room.Name: A Dead End
Room.Description: You are on a beaten path which extends north toward a city you can see through the tree tops. To the east is another road through the trees.

Room.Name: The Summer Road
Room.Description: The cobblestone road winds its way through the rolling hills and verdant plains, leading from a small town to the west to a massive city to the east. The city is a towering presence, its shining white walls a symbol of its wealth and power. A high white tower stands at the center of the city, casting its shadow far and wide. As one approaches the city, the beauty of the surrounding landscape comes into full view, with rolling hills giving way to bluffs and buttes that seem to rise up from the earth itself. The road is well-traveled, bustling with merchants and travelers alike, all heading towards the city to partake in its endless opportunities for trade and commerce. Despite the hustle and bustle of the road, there is a sense of awe and wonder in the air, as one realizes that they are approaching one of the great centers of civilization, a place of incredible power and prosperity.

Room.Name: The Summer Road
Room.Description: The cobblestone road winds its way through the rolling hills and verdant plains, leading from a small town to the west to a massive city to the east. Room.Name: The Summer Road
Room.Description: The cobblestone road winds its way through the rolling hills and verdant plains, leading from a small town to the west to a massive city to the east.

Room.Name: Road Through the Farmlands
Room.Description: This road winds its way across the open plains, its dirt surface rutted and pocked by the countless carts and wagons that have traveled this way. The grasses on either side of the road are tall and billowing in the breeze, a soft green sea that rustles and whispers in the wind. The road curves and twists, its path occasionally paralleling the wide, slow-moving river that runs alongside it. The river is dotted with occasional boats, their sails billowing in the wind as they make their way downstream. On the far bank, lush forests stand tall, their canopy casting dappled shadows on the water below.

Room.Name: Road Through the Farmlands
Room.Description: The cobblestone road winds its way through open fields of primitive farms, their crops stretching out in all directions like a patchwork quilt. The fields are dotted with farmhouses, their thatched roofs and wooden walls weathered by the elements. The road is well-trodden, its cobblestones worn and smooth from the countless carts and feet that have traveled this way. It curves and twists, its path occasionally paralleling the wide, rushing river that teems with fishermen. The river is alive with activity, the fishermen casting their nets and hauling in their catch, their boats bobbing up and down on the choppy water.

Room.Name: Road Through the Farmlands
Room.Description: The cobblestone road winds its way through open fields of primitive farms, their crops stretching out in all directions like a patchwork quilt. Room.Name: The Farm House
Room.Description: The farmhouse stands amidst the fields, its wooden walls weathered and gray with age. The roof is thatched, the thick straw overlaid in neat layers that provide shelter from the elements. The windows are small and simple, their frames sturdy and functional. The door is heavy and rough-hewn, its iron hinges rusted with time. A stone chimney rises from one end of the house, its brickwork blackened from years of use. The surrounding fields stretch out in all directions, their crops waving gently in the breeze.

Room.Name: A Road Through The Plains
Room.Description: This road winds its way across the open plains, its dirt surface rutted and pocked by the countless carts and wagons that have traveled this way. The grasses on either side of the road are tall and billowing in the breeze, a soft green sea that rustles and whispers in the wind. The road curves and twists, its path occasionally paralleling the wide, slow-moving river that runs alongside it. The river is dotted with occasional boats, their sails billowing in the wind as they make their way downstream. On the far bank, lush forests stand tall, their canopy casting dappled shadows on the water below.

Room.Name: Road Through a Cypress Forest
Room.Description: The cobblestone road winds its way through the light forest of cypress trees, their tall, slender trunks reaching skyward. The forest provides a natural canopy, filtering the light and casting a dappled pattern across the road. The cobblestones are old and weathered, their edges rounded with the passage of time and the countless feet and wheels that have traveled this way. The road curves and twists, its path occasionally paralleling the wide, slow-moving river that runs alongside it. The river is serene, its calm surface reflecting the trees and sky above.

Room.Name: Road Through a Cypress Forest
Room.Description: The cobblestone road winds its way through the light forest of cypress trees, their tall, slender trunks reaching skyward. The forest provides a natural canopy, filtering the light and casting a dappled pattern across the road. The cobblestones are old and weathered, their edges rounded with the passage of time and the countless feet and wheels that have traveled this way. The road curves and twists, its path occasionally paralleling the wide, slow-moving river that runs alongside it. The river is serene, its calm surface reflecting the trees and sky above.

Room.Name: Road Through the Farmlands
Room.Description: The cobblestone road winds its way through open fields of primitive farms, their crops stretching out in all directions like a patchwork quilt. The fields are dotted with farmhouses, their thatched roofs and wooden walls weathered by the elements. The road is well-trodden, its cobblestones worn and smooth from the countless carts and feet that have traveled this way. It curves and twists, its path occasionally paralleling the wide, rushing river that teems with fishermen. The river is alive with activity, the fishermen casting their nets and hauling in their catch, their boats bobbing up and down on the choppy water.

Room.Name: The Farm House
Room.Description: The farmhouse stands amidst the fields, its wooden walls weathered and gray with age. The roof is thatched, the thick straw overlaid in neat layers that provide shelter from the elements. The windows are small and simple, their frames sturdy and functional. The door is heavy and rough-hewn, its iron hinges rusted with time. A stone chimney rises from one end of the house, its brickwork blackened from years of use. The surrounding fields stretch out in all directions, their crops waving gently in the breeze.

Room.Name: A Well-Worn Path
Room.Description: This path through the hills surrounding the city is well-worn. Deep ruts indicate that it is frequently used by wagons and that the area receives plenty of heavy rain. A great white city rises up to the east and the path continues west toward a thick forest of rotted and hollowed out black trees.

Room.Name: A Well-Worn Path
Room.Description: This path through the hills surrounding the city is well-worn. Deep ruts indicate that it is frequently used by wagons and that the area receives plenty of heavy rain. A great white city rises up to the east and the path continues west toward a thick forest of rotted and hollowed out black trees. A tiny forest trail breaks away to the south, skirting the woods and leading down the hills to the river.

Room.Name: A Dying Forest Trail
Room.Description: Around you the trees appear dead and lifeless. Even the small vegetation that has grown on the forest floor has a taint of evil to it. Faint mist swirls around you and sends beams of light scattering into the darkened forest. Around you large ominous shapes move slowly through the shadows.

Room.Name: A Woodland Forest Trail
Room.Description: This tiny trail leads up from the Tigris river, skirting the edge of a dark and foreboding forest. Few sounds of life can be heard above the slight drone of the adjacent river's swiftly moving currents.

Room.Name: The Summer Road
Room.Description: The cobblestone road winds its way through the rolling hills and verdant plains, leading from a small town to the west to a massive city to the east.

NPC.name: carpenter
NPC.description: This man puts the scroll work on the chairs for most of the merchants in town. He is in very high demand and will only do a job for top gold.
NPC.longDescription: A carpenter is here working on a chair.

NPC.name: seamstress
NPC.description: She looks you over and decides she knows exactly what you need....a complete makeover and you can throw away your old rags. :)
NPC.longDescription: A seamstress is here cutting some green silk for a dress.

NPC.name: trader
NPC.description: He has many fine items and you can take the silk next door to the seamstress to get it made into a garment.
NPC.longDescription: A trader in ivory and silk has set up shop here.

NPC.name: weaponsmith
NPC.description: This man must be very strong the way he is holding that heavy hammer. He knows how to use it as a weapon too.
NPC.longDescription: A weaponsmith is here selling his fine swords.

NPC.name: armorer
NPC.description: This man used to be a knight until a he broke his leg, so now he just fixes other people's armor.
NPC.longDescription: The armorer is here repairing a shield.

NPC.name: baker
NPC.description: This man has a jolly round face, no doubt from tasting too many of the goodies that he bakes.
NPC.longDescription: The baker is here taking some pies out of the oven.

NPC.name: farmer
NPC.description: He has a deep bronze face from his days in the sun.
NPC.longDescription: A farmer is here selling some of his crop.

NPC.name: butcher
NPC.description: The butcher has strong arms from years of slicing through raw meat.
NPC.longDescription: A butcher is here dressing a lamb.

NPC.name: shopkeeper
NPC.description: This man has an air of infinite patience about him.
NPC.longDescription: The shopkeeper is waiting for you to order something.

NPC.name: jeweller
NPC.description: He has deft hands and a good eye. He will give you a good price for your stones.
NPC.longDescription: The jeweller is here examining a precious gemstone.

NPC.name: clockmaker man
NPC.description: This nice old man needs glasses from his years of peering at the intricate parts of clocks. He shows you his latest creation, a hand held clock that looks like a bird with the face of the clock hidden on its stomach.
NPC.longDescription: There is a man here making clocks.

NPC.name: innkeeper
NPC.description: This is a jolly fat old man, but, on a closer inspection, you see hard muscle under those rolls of fat. Maybe he was once a warrior.
NPC.longDescription: The innkeeper welcomes you to his humble abode.

NPC.name: tavernowner
NPC.description: This man is lean and mean, no doubt anyone who passes out in his tavern wakes up with nothing left.
NPC.longDescription: The tavernowner is here yelling at his serving girls to hurry up.

NPC.name: musician
NPC.description: The musician has various instruments about him. He looks at you suspiciously but then decides you are not a gleeman and therefore no threat to his meal and bed.
NPC.longDescription: A musician is here playing some songs.

NPC.name: gleeman
NPC.description: This gleeman has bushy white hair and long mustaches....he looks familiar but you can't quite place him. He has a harp and a flute and the patch covered cloak typical of all gleeman.
NPC.longDescription: A gleeman is here juggling balls and telling tales.

NPC.name: bodyguard
NPC.description: This guard looks mean. You don't want to mess with him.
NPC.longDescription: A bodyguard is here making sure his employer gets to the White Tower safely.
NPC.flags: NPC StayArea Warrior AssistAlign AssistGuard AssistVnum

NPC.name: beggar
NPC.description: This poor soul is down on his luck, maybe you could spare a little to make his life better?
NPC.longDescription: A beggar is here asking for alms.

NPC.name: guard
NPC.description: The guard looks at you sharply and then decides you are no threat.
NPC.longDescription: A guard of Tar Valon is here watching the people coming into Tar Valon.

NPC.name: guard
NPC.description: The guard looks at you sharply and then decides you are no threat.
NPC.longDescription: A guard of Tar Valon is standing here keeping the peace.

NPC.name: citizen
NPC.description: This poor soul must be sick of all these foreigners in his beautiful city.
NPC.longDescription: A citizen of Tar Valon is here trying to work his way through the crowd of foreigners.

NPC.name: sailor
NPC.description: This man has had way too much to drink. He looks ready to pass out but unfortunately for you, he still has the strength to sing.
NPC.longDescription: A sailor is here trying to sing his lungs out.

NPC.name: serving girl
NPC.description: She looks like a sweet girl....you wonder if she is really as nice as she seems.
NPC.longDescription: A serving girl hurries past you with barely a glance.

NPC.name: patron
NPC.description: This man looks very disreputable. You think he might be a thief but there are no thieves in Tar Valon thanks to the Aes Sedai. Better stay away from him anyway.
NPC.longDescription: A patron of the inn is slouched here.

NPC.name: maid
NPC.description: She is ready to show you to your rooms and then maybe show you a little more.
NPC.longDescription: A maid is here trying to avoid the wrath of the innkeeper.

NPC.name: commander
NPC.description: This man is the toughest guard you've seen yet. His armor is spotless and he wears his heron mark blade as if it truly belongs there.
NPC.longDescription: The commander of the guards of Tar Valon is standing here.

NPC.name: panhandler
NPC.description: This man looks like he is very upset about his lot in life and he's going to take it out on you!
NPC.longDescription: There is a panhandler here trying to shake the money out of you!

NPC.name: proprietress
NPC.description: She has a sharp eye and her hair is done up in a multitude of tiny braids.
NPC.longDescription: A proprietress of fine wines and liquors greets you.

NPC.name: sailor
NPC.description: You see nothing special about him.
NPC.longDescription: A sailor is here dicing with the others.

NPC.name: healer protector
NPC.description: Although retired from adventuring, the healer still lends a hand. Type 'heal' to see a listing of spells.
NPC.longDescription: A healer is here, selling spells.

NPC.name: man guard
NPC.description: You see nothing special about him.
NPC.longDescription: A man is guarding the enterance and patroling in the square.

NPC.name: ogier
NPC.description: You see an old ranger guarding his Ogier Grove from strangers. He is ready to attack all anti-rangers.
NPC.longDescription: The Ogier is guarding the Oiger grove.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Infrared ProtectionEvil ProtectionGood Sneak Camouflage

Item.Name: beef brisket
Item.LongDescription: Some strips of meat have been left here.

Item.Name: mutton chop
Item.LongDescription: A mutton chop has been left here.

Item.Name: wooden chair
Item.LongDescription: A wooden chair is waiting someone to sit.
Item.ExtraFlags: StandAt StandOn SitOn SitIn RestIn SleepAt PutAt PutOn

Item.Name: sheperd pie
Item.LongDescription: A big sheperd pie has been left here.

Item.Name: loaf bread
Item.LongDescription: A loaf of bread is here. It doesn't look too stale.

Item.Name: sword long
Item.LongDescription: A long sword made from good steel with heron markings on the blade is here.

Item.Name: shield
Item.LongDescription: A shield made from good heavy steel is here.

Item.Name: shirt
Item.LongDescription: A shirt made from steel links is lying here.

Item.Name: sleeves
Item.LongDescription: A set of steel sleeves is lying here.

Item.Name: helmet
Item.LongDescription: A helmet made from sturdy steel is lying here.

Item.Name: gauntlets
Item.LongDescription: A pair of steel gauntlets is lying here.

Item.Name: skirt
Item.LongDescription: A skirt of steel is here.

Item.Name: wine red
Item.LongDescription: A red wine bottle has been left here.

Item.Name: bottle white
Item.LongDescription: A dark bottle of white wine has been left here.

Item.Name: map tarvalon
Item.ShortDescription: a map of the city of TarValon
Item.LongDescription: A rolled up map is here.

Have fun!

Item.Name: pit
Item.LongDescription: A pit for sacrifices is in front of the altar.

ExtraDescription.Description: This is where you put money and items to help Doz expand this shrine,

Item.Name: fountain water
Item.LongDescription: A small white fountain gushes forth here.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is very nice. Made from fine white marble.

Item.Name: dice
Item.LongDescription: There is a dice forgotten on one corner.

Item.Name: axe soulslayer
Item.LongDescription: A battle axe named "Soulslayer" rests here.

ExtraDescription.Description: This large axe is intricately carved with hideous runes.

Item.Name: staff
Item.LongDescription: A Ranger's Staff is waiting his ranger to serve him well.
